newsitem.title: UK: BFI down nine despite revival in some areas.
newsitem.headline: BFI down nine despite revival in some areas.

text.p: The BFI was down nine on Tuesday to 1,411 points and owners' brokers were encouraged by a revival in exports and fixtures from the Mississippi for Panamaxes and by demand in the Atlantic for Capers.
But rates for both categories have continued to fall with 54,000 heavy grain USGulf to Japan for early May fixed by Hanjin and Continental at $23.50 no combination, down 25 cents from Monday.
Panamax and Caper rates also continued to weaken in the Pacific.
Capitano Giovanni 75,000 dwt was fixed by Showa on subjects delivery Japan about April 20/25 for an East Australia round voyage at a lower $11,500 daily.
At 1300 GMT BIFFEX was between 35 points lower to 10 points higher and turnover totalled 75 lots.
